>  Thieves are among my favorite characters -- partially because of their
>  speed,
>  and partially because of their priceless taunt skill.  The problem with 
them
>  is
>  that, like clerics, they aren't great if the computer is controlling them.
>  They
>  are very good if you are controlling them and no how forever.  Here's one
>  strategy I like to use with early-on thieves (works insanely well in the
>  slime
>  level).
>  
>  Drop a bomb, or a cluster of bombs -- however many your intelligence allows
>  you to make.  Throw a few knives at a nearby foe and wait for him to attack
>  you.  Run backwards, standing past the bombs, and wait for your foe to walk
>  over them.  If your foe is fast, you have to use the circle and strike
>  method,
>  which is a tad more difficult. :
>  
>  Say you are fighting a skeleton, or a group of them. They aren't very 
hardy,
>  but
>  they certainly are fast -- faster than your thief.  You aren't having a lot
>  of luck
>  dropping bombs and luring them into your trap, so you have to change your
>  strategy.  Bring some enemies to your cluster of bombs and begin circling
>  them,
>  keeping the circle small enough so that the enemy will stay on the bombs,
>  turning occasionally to toss a bone at you.  Eventually, the bombs will go
>  off
>  and harm your enemy.
>  
>  ---
>  
>  This is the strategy that has made thieves one of the more useful classes
>  for me.
>  That and their ability to go invisible whenever you so please (so long as
>  you've
>  got the intelligence to stay in those shadows) as well as a poison cloud
>  that can
>  be used similarly to bombs, except it does perpetual damage.  If you're 
used
>  to
>  using a thief, and practice a lot, you can send him or her into the enemy's
>  reproduction zones (with towers, bone piles, skeleton tents and whatnot) 
and
>  
>  bomb the bajeebers out of those guys, helping your team out considerably.
>  
>  Because of their speed, you can also leave thieves alone if you're fighting
>  slower enemies like elves.

One way I have found to be really effective with the thieves is that I get 
their intelligence up really high at the beginning.  Then I go into battle 
and make about 2 of my other guys (probably soldiers with a lot of 
constitution) just start beating on the other team.  Then since the soldiers 
are beating up on them, they are trying to kill the soldiers, right?  So I 
just go up to the closest one, throw a knife, and lure them onto me.  So now 
one of them is following me (my thief) and the rest are on my soldiers.  Then 
I start running south away from the one enemy that's lured onto me, then I 
wait until they are only so close to me while I am running:
    Fast Speed Creatures - about 3-4 spaces above my view window
    Moderate Speed Creatures - at the very top of my view window
    Slow Speed Creatures - about 3-4 spaces below the top of my view window

I wait until that point and then I just lay down as many bombs as I can in a 
row.  I continue running south and the enemy goes right into the middle of 
all those bombs and most of time just dies, right there.  And, if he doesn't, 
I just dodge him, go north, and repeat the process until he's dead.  Then I 
throw a knife at another guy that's picking on my soldiers and do the same, 
and so on and so forth.

--Tristan
